title: 111_hr689
content: The Act titled "Shasta-Trinity National Forest Administrative Jurisdiction Transfer Act" transfers administrative jurisdiction over specified Federal land from the Secretary of Agriculture to the Secretary of the Interior. The transferred land is within the Shasta-Trinity National Forest in California and shall be managed according to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The Shasta-Trinity National Forest Administrative Jurisdiction Transfer Act transfers administrative jurisdiction over specified Federal land from the Secretary of the Interior to the Secretary of Agriculture. The transferred land in California is managed according to relevant laws and regulations. The Shasta-Trinity National Forest Administrative Jurisdiction Transfer Act transfers specified Federal land to the Secretary of Agriculture for management in accordance with National Forest System laws. Land within the Trinity Alps Wilderness will maintain its wilderness status and be administered according to specific wilderness acts. Administrative provisions allow for minor adjustments by the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior may make minor corrections and adjustments to transfers under this Act for land management. Corrections are effective upon publication in the Federal Register. Hazardous substances on specified land must be identified and reported to the relevant Federal agency. The Act transfers land management responsibilities to the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior. Hazardous substance cleanup obligations remain with the respective Secretaries for the specified Federal lands. Existing rights and authorizations are not affected by the Act. The Act transfers land management responsibilities to the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior. The head of the agency to which administrative jurisdiction is transferred will administer interests or authorizations in accordance with applicable law. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
